intro: Talinum arachnoides, commonly known as the hairy talinum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its growth habit is typically herbaceous, with upright stems and broad, lobed foliage.
